localizedDescriptions.en: A framework to communicate information that has been captured and curated in anticipation of future need for care.
Additional composition metadata aligned with IHE-XDS which is not already available from the Reference Model COMPOSITION class.
The code specifying the precise type of document from the user perspective. Normally selected from a valueset provided by the local IHE-XDS Affinity Domain or national standard.

annotations.comment:
for example:  Pulmonary History and Physical, Discharge Summary, Ultrasound Report.
These codes are specific to an XDS Affinity Domain.

localizedDescriptions.en: GP synch rosi
Tp capture Care plan metadata
The name , preferably coded of the Care plan with which this journey is associated, and against which the composition was updated.
The identifier , preferably coded, of the Care plan with which this journey is associated, and against which the composition was updated.
A patient-journey specific identifier i.e unique to a patient's journey along a specific care pathway.
A framework to communicate the preferences of an individual for future medical treatment and care.
The type of advance care directive.

annotations.comment:
A short text description of the nature of the advance care directive. Coding of the type of directive with a terminology is preferred, where possible. It is expected that this is largely localised to reflect local policy and legislation.

For example, in the Netherlands, advance care directive types include, but are not limited to, 'Treatment prohibition', 'Treatment prohibition with completion of Completed Life', 'Euthanasia request' and 'Declaration of life'.

In the UK, advance care directive types include 'Advance Decision', 'Advance Directive' and 'Advance Statement'.

list.label: Has advance decision to refuse treatment (Mental Capacity Act 2005)

localizedLabels.en: Has advance decision to refuse treatment (Mental Capacity Act 2005)

list.label: Advance decision to refuse treatment retracted

localizedLabels.en: Advance decision to refuse treatment retracted

localizedDescriptions.en: The status of the advance care directive.

annotations.comment: Coding of the advance care directive status with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

localizedDescriptions.en: The individual has an advance care directive.
The individual does not have an advance care directive.
Information regarding where the advance care directive is stored and who has a copy of it.
Information regarding where the advance care directive is stored and how to gain access to it.

annotations.comment: For example, 'In the top drawer of the bedside table'.

localizedDescriptions.en: A multimedia resource that is generated or acquired during the provision of healthcare.
Digital representation of the resource.

annotations.comment: The actual content will be captured and stored using the Multimedia data type. For example: RTF or PDF for a document; JPG for an image; MP4 for a video; or WAV for an audio file. If the content is stored elsewhere the external location can be referenced using the URI data type.

localizedDescriptions.en: The time, date, partial date or period when the resource was generated or authored.
The date when this advance directive record was last updated.

annotations.comment: This may not be a formal review but e.g. a typo correction.

localizedDescriptions.en: The ability of an individual to use and understand information to make or consent to a decision, plan or intervention.
Description of the specific decision or plan to which the mental capacity status and assessment details relate.
The individual's mental capacity status.

list.value: B Person does not have mental capacity
list.label: B Person does not have mental capacity

list.value: C1 Person less than 16 with sufficient maturity
list.label: C1 Person less than 16 with sufficient maturity

list.value: C2 Person less than 16 without sufficient maturity
list.label: C2 Person less than 16 without sufficient maturity
Those holding parental responsibility have been involved

localizedLabels.en: Those holding parental responsibility have been involved

localizedDescriptions.en: Those holding parental responsibility have been fully involved in discussing and making this plan.
Narrative description of the individual's mental capacity.
Anticipatory decisions about the overall intent of care and possible interventions (including treatments, activities, and diagnostic or therapeutic procedures), asserted by a clinician.
The overall intent for future care and treatment for the individual.

annotations.comment:
The proposed value set is based on the MJA reference. 
Coding the intent of care with an external terminology is preferred, where possible.

localizedDescriptions.en: Narrative description about all advance intervention decisions, including the CPR decision.

annotations.comment: May be used to record a narrative overview of the advance intervention decision that reflect the specific circumstances for the individual. This includes any limitations, or conditional circumstances applicable, to interventions. This description may or may not be supported by structured data, recorded using the ‘Per intervention’ cluster. If both this narrative description and ‘Per intervention’ structured data is recorded, caution is required as there is a potential risk of divergence. This data element may be used to capture legacy data that is not available in a structured format.

localizedDescriptions.en: Decision about the extent of cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) intervention appropriate for this individual.
